--- title: "East Africa Poverty Indicators" author: "Mburu" date: "2023-02-11" output: html_document: toc: true toc_depth: 2 toc_float: collapsed: false smooth_scroll: false css: "style.css" highlight: pygments --- ## Data [kenya poverty data](https://data.humdata.org/dataset/world-bank-poverty-indicators-for-kenya) [Uganda poverty data](https://data.humdata.org/dataset/world-bank-poverty-indicators-for-uganda) [Tanzania poverty data](https://data.humdata.org/dataset/world-bank-poverty-indicators-for-tanzania) [Tanzania poverty data](https://data.humdata.org/dataset/world-bank-poverty-indicators-for-rwanda) ### Packages used ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(plotly) library(tidyverse) library(data.table) library(sf) library(DT) library(tmap) library(ggthemes) ``` ::: ## Read data - Read data and row bind ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} poverty_data <- fread("poverty_data/9c15861e-aeec-486a-8e4c-8bd7c9a40275_Data.csv", na.strings = c("NA", "..", " ")) poverty_data[sample(nrow(poverty_data), 10)] %>% datatable(options = list(scrollX = TRUE)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ## Minor Cleaning - Convert to long - Convert column names into lower - Replace space with underscore ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} nms_old <- names(poverty_data)[1:4] poverty_data <- melt(poverty_data, id.vars = nms_old, variable.factor = F, value.factor = F, variable.name = "year") poverty_data[, value:= as.numeric(value)] poverty_data[, year:= gsub("\\[.*", "", year)] poverty_data[, year := str_trim(year)] poverty_data[, year := as.numeric(year)] poverty_data <- poverty_data[!is.na(value)] ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} nms_new <- nms_old %>% tolower() nms_new <- gsub("\\s", "_", nms_new) nms_new ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "country_name" "country_code" "series_name" "series_code" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} setnames(poverty_data, nms_old, nms_new) poverty_data[, value:= as.numeric(value)] poverty_data <- poverty_data[!is.na(value)] poverty_data[sample(nrow(poverty_data), 10)] %>% datatable(options = list(scrollX = TRUE)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ## Plots ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} poverty_data[, year := as.numeric(year)] ea_country <- c("Kenya", "Uganda", "Ghana", "Tanzania") poverty_data[, unique(series_name)] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "Population, total" [2] "Gini index (World Bank estimate)" [3] "Income share held by fourth 20%" [4] "Income share held by highest 10%" [5] "Income share held by highest 20%" [6] "Income share held by lowest 10%" [7] "Income share held by lowest 20%" [8] "Income share held by second 20%" [9] "Income share held by third 20%" [10] "Number of poor at $1.90 a day (2011 PPP) (millions)" [11] "Number of poor at $3.20 a day (2011 PPP) (millions)" [12] "Number of poor at $5.50 a day (2011 PPP) (millions)" [13] "Poverty gap at $1.90 a day (2011 PPP) (%)" [14] "Poverty gap at $3.20 a day (2011 PPP) (% of population)" [15] "Poverty gap at $5.50 a day (2011 PPP) (% of population)" [16] "Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day (2011 PPP) (% of population)" [17] "Poverty headcount ratio at $3.20 a day (2011 PPP) (% of population)" [18] "Poverty headcount ratio at $5.50 a day (2011 PPP) (% of population)" [19] "Annualized growth in per capita real survey mean consumption or income, bottom 40% (%)" [20] "Annualized growth in per capita real survey mean consumption or income, top 10% (%)" [21] "Annualized growth in per capita real survey mean consumption or income, top 60% (%)" [22] "Annualized growth in per capita real survey mean consumption or income, total population (%)" [23] "Annualized growth in per capita real survey median income or consumption expenditure (%)" [24] "Median daily per capita income or consumption expenditure (2011 PPP)" [25] "Multidimensional poverty, Drinking water (% of population deprived)" [26] "Multidimensional poverty, Educational attainment (% of population deprived)" [27] "Multidimensional poverty, Educational enrollment (% of population deprived)" [28] "Multidimensional poverty, Electricity (% of population deprived)" [29] "Multidimensional poverty, Headcount ratio (% of population)" [30] "Multidimensional poverty, Monetary poverty (% of population deprived)" [31] "Multidimensional poverty, Sanitation (% of population deprived)" [32] "Poverty gap at national poverty lines (%)" [33] "Poverty gap at national poverty lines (%), including noncomparable values" [34] "Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day, age 0-14  (2011 PPP) (% of population age 0-14)" [35] "Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day, age 15-64 (2011 PPP) (% of population age 15-64)" [36] "Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day, age 65+ (2011 PPP) (% of population age 65+)" [37] "Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day, Female (2011 PPP) (% of female population)" [38] "Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day, Male  (2011 PPP) (% of male population)" [39] "Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day, rural (2011 PPP) (% of rural population)" [40] "Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day, urban (2011 PPP) (% of urban population)" [41] "Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day, with primary education (2011 PPP) (% of population age 16+ with primary education)" [42] "Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day, with secondary education (2011 PPP) (% of population age 16+ with secondary education)" [43] "Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day, without education (2011 PPP) (% of population age 16+ without education)" [44] "Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day,  with Tertiary/post-secondary education (2011 PPP) (% of population age 16+ with Tertiary/post-secondary education)" [45] "Poverty headcount ratio at national poverty lines (% of population)" [46] "Poverty headcount ratio at national poverty lines (% of population), including noncomparable values" [47] "Rural poverty gap at national poverty lines (%)" [48] "Rural poverty gap at national poverty lines (%), including noncomparable values" [49] "Rural poverty headcount ratio at national poverty lines (% of rural population)" [50] "Rural poverty headcount ratio at national poverty lines (% of rural population), including noncomparable values" [51] "Survey mean consumption or income per capita, bottom 40% (2011 PPP $ per day)" [52] "Survey mean consumption or income per capita, top 10% (2011 PPP $ per day)" [53] "Survey mean consumption or income per capita, top 60% (2011 PPP $ per day)" [54] "Survey mean consumption or income per capita, total population (2011 PPP $ per day)" [55] "Urban poverty gap at national poverty lines (%)" [56] "Urban poverty gap at national poverty lines (%), including noncomparable values" [57] "Urban poverty headcount ratio at national poverty lines (% of urban population)" [58] "Urban poverty headcount ratio at national poverty lines (% of urban population), including noncomparable values" [59] "" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} indicator <- c("Poverty gap at $1.90 a day (2011 PPP) (%)", "Income share held by highest 10%", "Income share held by lowest 10%", "Income share held by highest 20%", "Income share held by lowest 20%", "Multidimensional poverty, Drinking water (% of population deprived)", "Multidimensional poverty, Educational attainment (% of population deprived)", "Poverty gap at $3.20 a day (2011 PPP) (% of population)") poverty_data <- poverty_data[country_name %in% ea_country & series_name %in% indicator] poverty_data_split <- split(poverty_data, f = poverty_data$series_name) n <- length(poverty_data_split) my_plots <-htmltools::tagList() for (i in 1:n) { df = poverty_data_split[[i]] my_title = df[, unique(series_name)] mn = df[, min(year)] mx = df[, max(year)] breaks = seq(mn, mx,by = 3) p = ggplot(df, aes(year, value, group = country_name, color = country_name) ) + geom_line()+ theme_hc()+ labs(title = my_title, x = "year", y = "%")+ scale_color_viridis_d(name="")+ scale_x_continuous(breaks = breaks) my_plots[[i]] = ggplotly(p) } my_plots ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} economy_and_growth <- fread("API_3_DS2_en_csv_v2_1743760.csv") nms_old <- economy_and_growth[1,] %>% as.character() nms_old ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "Country Name" "Country Code" "Indicator Name" "Indicator Code" [5] "1960" "1961" "1962" "1963" [9] "1964" "1965" "1966" "1967" [13] "1968" "1969" "1970" "1971" [17] "1972" "1973" "1974" "1975" [21] "1976" "1977" "1978" "1979" [25] "1980" "1981" "1982" "1983" [29] "1984" "1985" "1986" "1987" [33] "1988" "1989" "1990" "1991" [37] "1992" "1993" "1994" "1995" [41] "1996" "1997" "1998" "1999" [45] "2000" "2001" "2002" "2003" [49] "2004" "2005" "2006" "2007" [53] "2008" "2009" "2010" "2011" [57] "2012" "2013" "2014" "2015" [61] "2016" "2017" "2018" "2019" [65] "2020" "NA" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} economy_and_growth <- economy_and_growth[-1,] names(economy_and_growth) <- nms_old nms_new <- nms_old %>% tolower() nms_new <- gsub("\\s", "_", nms_new) nms_new ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "country_name" "country_code" "indicator_name" "indicator_code" [5] "1960" "1961" "1962" "1963" [9] "1964" "1965" "1966" "1967" [13] "1968" "1969" "1970" "1971" [17] "1972" "1973" "1974" "1975" [21] "1976" "1977" "1978" "1979" [25] "1980" "1981" "1982" "1983" [29] "1984" "1985" "1986" "1987" [33] "1988" "1989" "1990" "1991" [37] "1992" "1993" "1994" "1995" [41] "1996" "1997" "1998" "1999" [45] "2000" "2001" "2002" "2003" [49] "2004" "2005" "2006" "2007" [53] "2008" "2009" "2010" "2011" [57] "2012" "2013" "2014" "2015" [61] "2016" "2017" "2018" "2019" [65] "2020" "na" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} setnames(economy_and_growth, nms_old, nms_new) id_vars <- c("country_name", "country_code", "indicator_name", "indicator_code") economy_and_growth <- melt(economy_and_growth, id.vars = id_vars, variable.factor = F, value.factor = F, variable.name = "year") economy_and_growth[, value:= as.numeric(value)] economy_and_growth[, year := as.numeric(year)] economy_and_growth <- economy_and_growth[!is.na(value)|!is.na(year)] economy_and_growth[sample(nrow(economy_and_growth), 10)] %>% datatable(options = list(scrollX = TRUE)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gni_gdp_savings_vec <- c("Gross savings (% of GNI)", "Gross savings (% of GDP)", "Total debt service (% of exports of goods, services and primary income)", "Total debt service (% of GNI)", "Trade (% of GDP)", "Current account balance (% of GDP)", "Exports of goods and services (annual % growth)", "Manufacturing, value added (annual % growth)", "Price level ratio of PPP conversion factor (GDP) to market exchange rate") ea_country <- c("Kenya", "Uganda", "Tanzania") economy_and_growth[, unique(country_name)] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "Aruba" [2] "Afghanistan" [3] "Angola" [4] "Albania" [5] "Andorra" [6] "Arab World" [7] "United Arab Emirates" [8] "Argentina" [9] "Armenia" [10] "American Samoa" [11] "Antigua and Barbuda" [12] "Australia" [13] "Austria" [14] "Azerbaijan" [15] "Burundi" [16] "Belgium" [17] "Benin" [18] "Burkina Faso" [19] "Bangladesh" [20] "Bulgaria" [21] "Bahrain" [22] "Bahamas, The" [23] "Bosnia and Herzegovina" [24] "Belarus" [25] "Belize" [26] "Bermuda" [27] "Bolivia" [28] "Brazil" [29] "Barbados" [30] "Brunei Darussalam" [31] "Bhutan" [32] "Botswana" [33] "Central African Republic" [34] "Canada" [35] "Central Europe and the Baltics" [36] "Switzerland" [37] "Channel Islands" [38] "Chile" [39] "China" [40] "Cote d'Ivoire" [41] "Cameroon" [42] "Congo, Dem. [262] "South Africa" [263] "Zambia" [264] "Zimbabwe" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} gni_gdp_savings_df <- economy_and_growth[indicator_name %in% gni_gdp_savings_vec & country_name %in% ea_country ] ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gni_gdp_savings_df_split <- split(gni_gdp_savings_df, f = gni_gdp_savings_df$indicator_name) n <- length(gni_gdp_savings_df_split) #my_plots_econ <-htmltools::tagList() my_plots_econ <-list() for (i in 1:n) { df = gni_gdp_savings_df_split[[i]] my_title = df[, unique(indicator_name)] mn = df[, min(year)] mx = df[, max(year)] breaks = seq(mn, mx,by = 5) p = ggplot(df, aes(year, value, group = country_name, color = country_name) ) + geom_line(size = .3)+ theme_hc()+ labs(title = my_title, x = "year", y = "%")+ scale_color_colorblind(name="")+ scale_x_continuous(breaks = breaks) my_plots_econ[[i]] = ggplotly(p) } my_plots_econ ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [[1]] [[2]] [[3]] [[4]] [[5]] [[6]] [[7]] [[8]] [[9]] ``` ::: :::
